item.title: My First Post
item.description: First port Hi, this is Zheng Wei. I’m documenting my learning notes in this blog😉. 你好 我叫真伪 哈喽 访问我的网站 function helloWorld() { console.log('Hello, world!'); } ## nihao niaho def greet(name): print("Hello, " + name + "!") nihao

item.title: About
item.description: I got a Bachelor’s degree from the University of Trento, and my Master’s degree from the University of Milan. Currently, I work as a Software Engineer at Amazon Berlin. During my studies, I gained a lot of interest in algorithms and data structures, as well as distributed systems, databases, and search engines. I explored those topics with my master’s thesis on graph compression, and with side projects on LSM tree and search engine implementations.

item.title: Library
item.description: Designing Data-Intensive Applications Excellent book about many distributed systems concepts, databases, and big data processing ideas. Database Internals Deep dive into database concepts that the first book only touches briefly, like data organization on disk, log-structured databases, and so on. It also covers distributed systems. Building Microservices Concepts tied to developing independent services rather than huge monoliths. Touches testing, CI/CD, communication styles and so on. Introduction to information retrieval How search engines work, how they are built and maintained.
